notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: At a meeting of the board of directors of the Workers Cooperative Society, which operates two restaurants, the manager of one restaurant appeared demanding a raise of $2.00 per week for all workers, and $5.00 for himself, plus two weeks vacation. He threatened with a strike, if these demands meet refusal.

The board of directors are not in favor of a strike, although they cannot pay more than their income permits. Nevertheless, a meeting will be held Saturday evening where a committee of the union to which the workers belong will be expected.
